content:
Diagnosis:		Endometrial carcinosarcoma

Stage:		FIGO Stage IIIA (T3aN0M0)

Biomarkers:	TP53 mutation positive, microsatellite stable

Management:	15 Mar 2024 Total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy with omental biopsy

Histology:	Carcinosarcoma with serosal breach. Omentum negative. 0/12 nodes involved.

Current situation:	Post-operative review prior to adjuvant treatment

[redacted name] attended clinic today following her recent surgery. She has made an excellent recovery with good wound healing and is now back to her baseline mobility. Her post-operative pain has largely resolved and she is managing well at home with her husband's support. Performance status is 0.

We discussed the role of adjuvant chemotherapy with carboplatin and paclitaxel. She understands the aims of treatment and the common side effects. She is keen to proceed.

Plan is to commence chemotherapy in 2 weeks' time. We will arrange baseline blood tests, ECG, and staging CT chest/abdomen/pelvis prior to treatment start. Follow-up arranged for 3 weeks' time to review after first cycle.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Carcinosarcoma with serosal breach, 0/12 nodes involved, omentum negative

cancer_timeline.value: Total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy with omental biopsy
Histology confirms carcinosarcoma with serosal breach, 0/12 nodes involved

status_updates.value: Recently diagnosed endometrial carcinosarcoma, post-operative review showing good recovery from surgery
Plan to commence adjuvant carboplatin and paclitaxel chemotherapy
Arranging baseline blood tests, ECG, and staging CT chest/abdomen/pelvis
Review in 3 weeks after first cycle of chemotherapy
